Stock Market Performance¶

A look at stock market indexes, specifically the performance relative to historical trends.

In [3]:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from io import StringIO
from urllib.error import HTTPError
import altair as alt
import yfinance as yf

from os import environ

try:
    # for local execution
    apiKeyFromFile = open("/Users/kyledunn/fredApiKey.txt", "r").read().strip()
except FileNotFoundError:
    apiKeyFromFile = None
    pass
# for CI
apiKey = environ.get("FRED_API_KEY", apiKeyFromFile)

from io import BytesIO
from zipfile import ZipFile
from urllib.request import urlopen
    
def getSeries(series="", apiKey=None, description=None):
    fetchCommand = "https://api.stlouisfed.org/fred/series/observations?series_id={s}&realtime_end=9999-12-31&api_key={k}&file_type=txt" 
    
    resp = urlopen(fetchCommand.format(s=series, k=apiKey))
    zipfile = ZipFile(BytesIO(resp.read()))
    
    filesInZip = zipfile.namelist()
    
    data = zipfile.open(filesInZip[1])
    
    if description is None:
        description = series
    
    df = pd.read_csv(data, sep="\t", header=None, skiprows=1,
                       names=["date", description, "rt_start", "rt_end"], na_values=".")
    
    df['date'] = pd.to_datetime(df.date)
    
    return df.set_index("date")

subset = df_dji[df_dji.index <= '1995-12-31']

y = subset.Close.values
x = [n for n, v in enumerate(subset.index.values)]

z = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)

        # a * 1 * x^1 + b 
trend = np.add(np.multiply(z[1], 1), np.multiply(range(df_dji.shape[0]), z[0]))

sp500 = yf.Ticker("^GSPC")

# get historical market data
df_sp500 = sp500.history(period="max")

#df_sp500.head()

init = df_sp500[(df_sp500.index > '1979-12-31')]
subset = init[(init.index <= '1995-12-31')]

y = subset.Close.values
x = range(subset.shape[0])

z = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)

trend = np.add(np.multiply(z[1], 1), np.multiply(range(init.shape[0]), z[0]))

(
    alt.Chart(pd.DataFrame(index=init.index, data=trend, columns=['fit']).reset_index()).mark_line(color='blue').encode(
        alt.X('Date:T', axis=alt.Axis(title='')),
        alt.Y('fit:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title=''))
    ) +\
    alt.Chart(init.reset_index()).mark_line(color='black').encode(
        alt.X('Date:T', axis=alt.Axis(title='')),
        alt.Y('Close:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title='Index Value')),
        tooltip=[alt.Tooltip('Date:T'), alt.Tooltip('Close:Q')]
    )
).properties(
    title='US S&P 500',
    width=750,
    height=400,
    background='white'
)

df_returns = df_sp500.copy().reset_index().dropna()

df_returns['Return'] = df_returns['Close'].pct_change(1).apply(lambda v: v * 100)
#df_returns['Volume'] = df_sp500['Volume']

base = alt.Chart(df_returns[df_returns.Date.dt.year.isin([2008, 2009, 2010, 2018, 2019, 2020])])

xscale = alt.Scale(domain=(0, 12e9))
yscale = alt.Scale(domain=(-20, 20))

area_args = {'opacity': .3, 'interpolate': 'basis'}

points = base.mark_point().encode(
    alt.X('Volume:Q'),
    alt.Y('Return:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title='1 day return [%]'), scale=alt.Scale(clamp=True, domain=(-15, 15))),
    alt.Color('year(Date):N', title='Year'),
    tooltip=[alt.Tooltip('Date:T'), alt.Tooltip('Return:Q', format=',.02f')]
).properties(
    title='Daily Returns vs Volume for S&P 500',
    width=600,
    height=450,
)

top_hist = base.mark_area(**area_args).encode(
    alt.X('Volume:Q',
          # when using bins, the axis scale is set through
          # the bin extent, so we do not specify the scale here
          # (which would be ignored anyway)
          bin=alt.Bin(maxbins=20, extent=xscale.domain),
          stack=None,
          title=''
         ),
    alt.Y('count()', stack=None, title=''),
    alt.Color('year(Date):N'),
    tooltip=alt.Tooltip('year(Date):N')
).properties(
    height=100,
    width=600
)

right_hist = base.mark_area(**area_args).encode(
    alt.Y('Return:Q',
          bin=alt.Bin(maxbins=20, extent=yscale.domain),
          stack=None,
          title='',
         ),
    alt.X('count()', stack=None, title=''),
    alt.Color('year(Date):N'),
).properties(
    width=100,
    height=450
)

top_hist & (points | right_hist)

In [ ]:
# Compute CAGR for each period

years = 20

totals = []
for i in range(0, int(returns.shape[0]-(years*12)-1)):
    totals.append(dict({
        "start": returns.iloc[i, 0],
        "return": ((returns.iloc[(years*12)+(i), 1] / returns.iloc[i, 1])**(1/years) - 1) * 100
    }))
In [ ]:
df_totals = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(totals)

alt.Chart(df_totals).mark_line().encode(
    alt.X('start:T', axis=alt.Axis(title='')),
    alt.Y('return:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title=f'Total {years}yr Return [CAGR]'))
).properties(
    title='Inflation Adjusted S&P 500 Returns (CAGR) vs Start Date of Investment',
    width=700,
    height=450
)

How likely is it for a 20 year investment in the S&P 500 to make 7% CAGR?¶

In [ ]:
hist = alt.Chart(df_totals).transform_calculate(
    decade='toString(floor(year(datum.start) / 10)) + "0\'s"'
).transform_density(
    'return',
    as_=['return', 'density'],
).mark_area(color='darkorange', opacity=0.5).encode(
    alt.X("return:O", scale=alt.Scale(clamp=True), axis=alt.Axis(title='', labels=False, ticks=False)),
    alt.Y('density:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title='Likelihood [orange]'))
).properties(
    title='Distribution of Inflation Adjusted S&P 500 Returns (CAGR)',
    width=700,
    height=450
)

cumu = alt.Chart(df_totals).mark_line(color='black', interpolate='step-after', strokeWidth=2, strokeDash=[3, 6]).transform_joinaggregate(
    total='count(*)'
).transform_calculate(
    pct='1 / datum.total'
).transform_window(
    frame=[None, 0],
    sort=[{"field": "return"}],
    cumu='sum(pct)'
).encode(
    alt.X("return:Q", axis=alt.Axis(title=f'{years}yr CAGR Return [%]', orient='bottom')),
    alt.Y('cumu:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title='Cumulative Likelihood [black]')),
    tooltip=[alt.Tooltip('cumu:Q', title='Likelihood of return being less than or equal', format=',.02f'),
             alt.Tooltip('return:Q', title=' CAGR [%]', format=',.02f')]
).properties(
    title='Distribution of Inflation Adjusted S&P 500 Returns (CAGR)',
    width=700,
    height=450,
)

c = (hist + cumu).resolve_scale(y='independent').properties(background='white')

#c.save('sp500-returns-and-performance.png')
c.display()

How do the S&P 500 returns vary with the decade the investment started?¶

In [ ]:
%%capture

step = 35
overlap = 1

histf = alt.Chart(df_totals, height=step).transform_calculate(
    Decade='toString(floor(year(datum.start) / 10)) + "0\'s"'
).transform_joinaggregate(
    mean_return='mean(return)', groupby=['Decade']
).transform_bin(
    ['bin_max', 'bin_min'], 'return'
).transform_aggregate(
    value='count()', groupby=['Decade', 'mean_return', 'bin_min', 'bin_max']
).transform_impute(
    impute='value', groupby=['Decade', 'mean_return'], key='bin_min', value=0
).mark_area(interpolate='monotone', fillOpacity=0.7, stroke='lightgray', strokeWidth=0.5).encode(
    alt.X('bin_min:Q', bin='binned', title=f'{years}yr CAGR Return [%]'),
    alt.Y('value:Q', scale=alt.Scale(range=[step, -step * overlap]), axis=None),
    alt.Fill('mean_return:Q', legend=None, scale=alt.Scale(domain=[-1, 8], scheme='plasma'))
).facet(
    row=alt.Row('Decade:O', title='Starting Decade', header=alt.Header(labelAngle=0)),
).properties(
    title='Distribution of Inflation Adjusted S&P 500 Returns (CAGR)',
    bounds='flush'
).configure_facet(
    spacing=0,
).configure_view(
    stroke=None,
    width=550
)

histf.save('sp500-returns-and-performance.png')

#%%time

urlFor = lambda t: "https://stockrow.com/api/companies/{}/financials.xlsx?dimension=Q&section=Balance%20Sheet&sort=desc".format(t)
def dfFor(t):
    try:
        tmp = pd.read_excel(urlFor(t), engine='openpyxl')
        tmp.columns = list(map(lambda v: v if isinstance(v, str) else "{}-{}-{}".format(v.year, v.month, v.day), tmp.columns.to_list()))
        tmp = tmp.dropna().set_index("Unnamed: 0").T

        tmp['Ticker'] = [t]*tmp.shape[0]
        return tmp
    except HTTPError:
        #print("{} failed".format(t))
        return None
    except KeyError:
        #print("{} failed".format(t))
        return None

map_sp500 = map(dfFor, df_spex['Ticker Symbol'].values)

all_df = pd.concat(map_sp500)

#all_df.head()

all_df['dt'] = pd.to_datetime(all_df.index, format="%Y-%m-%d")

def doRidgeLineFor(df, metric, percentile=85):
    field = metric.replace(" ", "_")
    return alt.Chart(df, height=step).transform_calculate(
        yr='year(datum.dt)'
    ).transform_density(
        metric,
        as_=[f'{field}', 'density'],
        extent=[df[metric].quantile(0), df[metric].quantile(percentile / 100)],
        maxsteps=1000,
        groupby=['yr']
    ).mark_area().encode(
        alt.X(f'{field}:Q', title=f'{metric} [USD]', scale=alt.Scale(zero=False)),
        alt.Color('yr:N', title='Year', scale=alt.Scale(scheme='accent')),
        alt.Y(
            'density:Q',
            impute=None,
            title=None,
            axis=alt.Axis(labels=False, values=[0], grid=False, ticks=True),
        )
    ).facet(
        row=alt.Row(
            f'yr:N',
            title='', #Fraction of Companies',
            header=alt.Header(labels=False, labelAngle=0) #, labelAlign='left', labelAnchor='end')
        )
    ).properties(
        title=f"Changing {metric} Profile of S&P 500 (ex tech, up to {percentile}th percentile)",
        bounds='flush'
    ).configure_facet(
        spacing=0
    ).configure_view(
        stroke=None,
        width=650
    ).configure_title(
        anchor='middle'
    )

def violinFor(df, metric='Total Debt'):
    return alt.Chart(df[['dt', metric]].dropna()).transform_calculate(
        yr='year(datum.dt)'
    ).transform_density(
        metric,
        as_=['{}'.format(metric.replace(" ", "_")), 'density'],
        extent=[df[metric].quantile(0.1), df[metric].quantile(0.9)],
        maxsteps=1000,
        groupby=['yr']
    ).mark_area(orient='horizontal').encode(
        alt.Y('{}:Q'.format(metric.replace(" ", "_"))),
        alt.Color('yr:N', title='Year'),
        x=alt.X(
            'density:Q',
            stack='center',
            impute=None,
            title=None,
            axis=alt.Axis(labels=False, values=[0],grid=False, ticks=True),
        ),
        column=alt.Column(
            'yr:N',
            header=alt.Header(
                titleOrient='bottom',
                labelOrient='bottom',
                labelPadding=0,
            ),
        )
    ).properties(
        title=f"Changing {metric} Profile of S&P 500 (ex tech)",
        width=100
    )

def chartFor(df, metric='Long Term Debt (Total)', color='steelblue'):
    summed = df.copy().reset_index().groupby("dt").sum().resample('1Q').mean()

    return alt.Chart(summed.sort_index().reset_index()[:-1]).mark_line(color=color).encode(
        alt.X("dt:T", axis=alt.Axis(title='', format="%b %Y")),
        alt.Y(f"{metric}:Q", axis=alt.Axis(title=f"{metric} [USD]", format='$,.0f')),
        tooltip=[alt.Tooltip("dt:T", format="%b %Y"), alt.Tooltip(f"{metric}:Q")]
    ).properties(
        title=f"{metric} trend for S&P 500 (Ex Technology)",
        width=700,
        height=450
    )
  
def doComboChartFor(metric, df, yLabel='Revenue [Million USD]', color='royalblue', background=True):
    pmp = df[metric].sort_index().copy().reset_index().dropna()
    
    brush = alt.selection(type='interval', encodings=['x'])
    
    base = alt.Chart(pmp).mark_line(color='purple').encode(
        alt.X('dt:T', axis=alt.Axis(title='', format='%b %Y')),
        alt.Y(f'{metric}:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title=yLabel)),
        tooltip=[alt.Tooltip("dt:T", format="%b %Y"), alt.Tooltip(f"yoy:Q", format=",.02f")]
    ).properties(
        width=750,
        height=450
    )
    
    upper = base.mark_bar(color=color, size=2.5).transform_window(
        window=[alt.WindowFieldDef("lag", metric, param=12, **{ 'as': 'previous' })],
        sort=[{"field": "dt"}],
    ).transform_calculate(
        yoy=f"((datum['{metric}'] - datum.previous) / datum.previous) * 100"
    ).transform_filter("datum['yoy'] < 100").encode(
        alt.X('dt:T', axis=alt.Axis(title='', format='%b %Y'), scale=alt.Scale(domain=brush), impute=alt.ImputeParams(value=None)),
        alt.Y('yoy:Q', axis=alt.Axis(title='Year over Year Revenue Growth [%]')),
        color=alt.condition("datum['yoy'] < 0",
            alt.value('lightsalmon'),
            alt.value(color)
        ),
        tooltip=[alt.Tooltip('dt:T', format='%B %Y', title='Period'), alt.Tooltip('yoy:Q', format=',.02f')]
    ).properties(
        title=f'US: {metric}',
    )
    
    lower = base.properties(
        height=100
    ).add_selection(brush)

    return (upper & lower).properties(background='white') if background else (upper & lower)
  
    
chartFor(all_df[all_df['dt'] > '2012-01-01'])

def yoyChartFor(df, metric='Long Term Debt (Total)'):
    summed = df.copy().reset_index().groupby("dt").sum().resample('1Q').mean()
    yoy = summed.sort_index().dropna().pct_change(4).dropna() #.apply(lambda v: v * 100)

    return alt.Chart(yoy.sort_index().reset_index()[:-1]).mark_bar(size=12).encode(
        alt.X("dt:T", axis=alt.Axis(title='', format="%b %Y")),
        alt.Y(f"{metric}:Q", axis=alt.Axis(title=f"{metric} Growth [year-over-year %]", format='.0%')),
        tooltip=[alt.Tooltip("dt:T", format="%b %Y"), alt.Tooltip(f"{metric}:Q", format='.02%')],
        color=alt.condition(f"datum['{metric}'] < 0",
            alt.value('lightsalmon'),
            alt.value('royalblue')
        )
    ).properties(
        title=f"{metric} growth for S&P 500 (Ex Technology)",
        width=700,
        height=450
    )
